title: Quiz 4: IUCDs, VSC & Barrier Methods
description: Test your knowledge on Intrauterine Devices, Surgical Contraception (BTL/Vasectomy), and Barrier methods.

questions.question: Match the 'SOPIE' mechanism of action for IUCDs:
questions.explanation: S=Sperm immobility, O=Ovum motility, P=Prostaglandin, I=Implantation interference, E=Endometrium inflammation.
questions.hint: This acronym describes how the IUCD prevents pregnancy.

questions.question: Select all conditions that are CONTRAINDICATIONS for IUCD insertion:
questions.explanation: IUCDs should not be used in pregnancy, PID, STI risk, septic abortion, or unexplained bleeding. Breastfeeding is NOT a contraindication.
questions.hint: Think about infection risk and uterine safety.

questions.question: A man is considered immediately sterile after a vasectomy procedure.
questions.explanation: Vasectomy is NOT effective immediately. Semen contains sperm for 3-4 months (10-15 ejaculations). Backup contraception is required.
questions.hint: Are there sperm still stored in the tubes?

questions.question: A diaphragm must be left in place for at least ___BLANK___ hours after intercourse but removed before 24 hours.
questions.explanation: The diaphragm must remain for 6-8 hours to ensure spermicide effectiveness but removed to prevent infection/toxic shock.
questions.hint: It needs time to ensure sperm are inactive.

questions.question: Order the steps of IUCD Insertion:
questions.explanation: Exam -> Stabilize -> Measure -> Insert -> Finish. Sounding is critical before insertion.
questions.hint: You must measure the uterus before putting the device in.

questions.question: Which surgical method involves tying and cutting the fallopian tubes?
questions.explanation: Bilateral Tubal Ligation (BTL) is the permanent surgical method for females.

questions.question: Which of the following is a limitation of barrier methods (like condoms)?
questions.explanation: Barrier methods can fail due to slipping, tearing, or user error. They do not have systemic hormonal effects.

questions.question: Study the table below. Which IUCD type is non-medicated and no longer in circulation?

richContent.content:
TypeFeature
Cu T 380AMedicated (Copper)
MirenaHormone Releasing
Lippers LoopNon-medicated (Plastic)

questions.explanation: Lippers Loop is an inert plastic device (non-medicated) that is largely obsolete.
questions.hint: It is named after a person and is a 'loop'.

questions.question: Vasectomy works by removing the testicles.
questions.explanation: Vasectomy involves cutting the vas deferens, not removing the testicles (castration). Hormonal function remains normal.
questions.hint: It is just blocking the tube, not removing the organ.

questions.question: Which of the following are potential complications of IUCD insertion?
questions.explanation: Complications include perforation, expulsion, infection, pain/cramps, and heavy bleeding. Weight gain is hormonal, not related to copper IUCDs.
questions.hint: Think about local physical effects on the uterus.
